description: From Middle English fitlokes, feetlakkes pl, equivalent to foot +‎ lock (“tuft of hair”). Cognate with Dutch vitlok, vittelokke, vitslok, German Fissloch, Fisloch, Fislach (“fetlock; pastern”).

entries.meaning: A joint of the horse's leg below the knee or hock and above the hoof.
The tuft of hair that grows at this joint.
